intended_purpose: The ArrhythmiaDetector (v2.1.0) is a software medical device intended to assist qualified cardiologists in the diagnosis of cardiac arrhythmia by analyzing 12-lead ECG signal data and calculating a risk score.
target_audience: Qualified Cardiologists and trained Medical Technicians (under supervision)
accuracy_metrics: Sensitivity: 0.95 (95%) on standard test sets. The system requires a minimum of 100 data points per inference.
robustness_level: The system includes outlier rejection and signal-to-noise validation algorithms capable of handling input noise variance up to 10%.
cybersecurity_level: High. Data at rest is encrypted using AES-256; data in transit uses TLS 1.3. Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enforced for access.
circumstances_performance: Performance accuracy is significantly reduced in high-noise environments (e.g., during active patient movement) or if the signal variance exceeds 10%.
foreseeable_misuse: Use on pediatric patients (under 18 years old); Reliance on the AI prediction as a final diagnosis without cardiologist review; Use of non-FDA approved ECG capture hardware.
misuse_mitigation: The system is explicitly contraindicated for pediatric use in the labelling. Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) restricts 'technician' roles to maintenance only, preventing diagnostic sign-off.
risks_health_safety: Risk of false negatives (missed arrhythmia) or false positives (unnecessary medical intervention).
risks_mitigation: The system mandates manual review for any prediction with a confidence score below 80%. The AI output is a decision-support aid, not a standalone diagnostic.
input_specifications: 12-lead ECG data in array format (float values, millivolts). Minimum 100 data points required per sequence. Must be captured via FDA-approved ECG hardware.
limitations_explainability: The risk score is a statistical aggregation (mean of filtered data) and does not isolate specific morphological waveforms for the user.
explainability_mitigation: Users must verify the risk score against the visual representation of the raw ECG signal provided by the capture device.
human_oversight: Cardiologists must review all positive findings and any result where system confidence is <80%. Final diagnostic decision rests with the human operator.
lifecycle_changes: Monthly calibration checks and regular security patching.
lifetime_trigger: Hardware degradation or expiration of the 3-year validated operational window.
maintenance_measures: Automated monthly calibration checks (`run_maintenance_check`) and monthly vulnerability patching.
software_updates: Security patches applied monthly; Bi-annual penetration testing remediation.
computational_resources: 16GB RAM, NVIDIA GPU with minimum 8GB VRAM.
logging_collection: Automated system logging via Python logging module capturing User, Action, Patient ID (pseudonymized), Prediction, and Confidence.
logging_storage: Secure local storage with daily rotation, retained for 365 days. Protected by SHA-256 integrity checks.
logging_interpretation: Logs contain 'Conf' (Confidence) values. A confidence value < 0.80 indicates the inference was flagged for mandatory manual review.
